intro: Draba verna proles furcipila, commonly known as the early whitlow grass, is a small, flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cross-shaped flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It produces delicate white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh environments.
